html: Rituals performed under the Mosaic Code such as the slaughter of unblemished beasts and the offering of firstfruits (Exodus 12:5; 20:24; 30:1; Leviticus 2:12-16; 4:32; 27:16) become offensive once the Lamb of God is slaughtered that they foreshadowed (Isaiah 53:7, 10; 1 Corinthians 15:20-23). People who perpetuate such cultic practices come under Jehovah’s condemnation when he fulfills their worst fears. For not responding when Jehovah “called” and “spoke” to them through his servant—instead doing evil and what is contrary to his will—they themselves are slaughtered (Isaiah 65:12).
